item.title: CSS note
item.description:
What is:

  • unset // Go back to last inherited value.
  • flex-grow, flex-shrink // Decide which and how the element takes up remaining spaces;
  • flex-warp; // opposite to overflow:scroll, make newline if too many flex element
  • align-items: flex-start; //Align the element on the direction perpendicular to the flex direction. For row, stick to the top of the box.
  • display: inline-flex; // Set the outer display model of the box to be flex as well
  • display: inline-block; // Block vs inline vs inline-block. inline-block is a bit like flex blox?
  • overflow-y: scroll; // Create scroll bar when element overflows

item.title: merge-sort
item.description:
let articleContent = document.querySelector(".article-content")
// Create sorting elements
let size = 10
for (let i = 0; i < size; i = i + 1){
    let sortItem = document.createElement("div")
    sortItem.classList.add("sortItem")
    sortItem.style = "display: inline-block; border: solid black 2px; padding: 1rem"
    sortItem.innerHTML = Math.floor(Math.random() * 20)
    articleContent.prepend(sortItem)
    // add the element at the top of the div
}
let sortItems = Array.from(document.querySelectorAll(".sortItem"))

function combine(array1, array2){
    let pivot = 0
    let sortedArray = []
    // check whether pivot index is in the array
    // when the pivot index increased larger than
    while( (pivot in left) || (pivot in right) )
        if (pivot in left && pivot in right){
            if (left[pivot] <= right[pivot]){
                sortedArray.push(left[pivot])
                sortedArray.push(right[pivot])
            }
            else{
                sortedArray.push(right[pivot])
                sortedArray.push(left[pivot])
            }
        }
        else if (pivot in left){
            sortedArray.push(left[pivot])
        }
        else if (pivot in right){
            sortedArray.push(right[pivot])
        }
    pivot += 1
    return sortedArray
}
function mergesort(array){
    console.log(array)
    if (array.length == 1 || array.length == 0){
        return array
    }
    left = array.slice(0, Math.floor(sortItems.length / 2))
    right = array.slice(Math.floor(sortItems.length / 2))
    console.log("left")
    console.log(left)
    console.log("right")
    console.log(right)
    mergesort(left)
    mergesort(right)
    return combine(left, right)
}
mergesort(sortItems)

One can tell that the artist has a knack for beautiful details (Maho’s face and hair) and simplistic designs (the plushie in Maho’s hands).

prevent bad idiom
You are not going to let how you feel about a particular class stand in the way of your personal future, are you?

stand in your way

I made an effort to help lobby for localization of R;NE and DaSH

lobby (sth) to

He cites numerous examples of obdurate scientists in the face of data as evidence for this conclusion.

stubborn
indoctrinate
give v learn bad
Every time you put off something you dislike, you indoctrinate yourself with fears.

DISAPPROVING
imbued with
instil

adj good

appropriate
fervour
interest n strong
You may come away from it with a brand-new fervor for phantom-breaking.

FORMAL

fierce
enthusiasm

dedication

make pledge to

n object

FORMAL

The cast of game’s cast of playable fighters is varied—to a fault, even.

n work

do/take commissions

surprise adj personality good
The attention to detail in these pieces are phenomenal—for example, one can see that the sky in the second piece is partially composed of awakened Sumo Stickers.

stellar
top-notch

v important writing
One of the biggest themes of Steins;Gate 0, is struggle, but in this release, that struggle is downplayed quite a bit.

outlook
opinion n future
The experience of nearly died in a sailing accident had a huge impact on his outlook on life.

ALT:scenery
notion
titbit
n less info

Longtime SciADV/SVN fans will attest that single cour adaptations have not served the series well in the past.

adj relationship similar occurrence

once and for all
repeat emphasis idiom
It's time to purge this timeline once and for all!

in question
phrase

paramount
Redundancy is paramount in life as a whole.

Providing instruction to small groups of students is a tried and tested way to differentiate and support students.

tried and trusted

utilise

effort adj difficult personality

get even
harm conflict idiom

apparently
aware adv modifier
Giveaways, and a Phantom Breaker: Omnia card game, apparently(?!) I hope they’re planning on giving away more of these…

adj personality

嚴肅的；冷靜的

Participants were able to go to eight different stores throughout the city and collect Steins Gate themed stamps.

The trash pickers are decidedly not a part of the grand plan.

plainly

adv modifier

As the weeks rolled by, they began to string complete sentences together with less contortion of their faces.

Literary
trying
sad adj bad

expertise

idiom

vague

n different

This can help erase issues of labeling and stigmatizing students—small group instruction is appropriate for every student.

hands-on experience

hyped-up

When the piece is flipped upside down, the illustration depicts imagery from the Beta attractor field.

flurry of speculation

meanwhile

~emanate
